member.summary: Sets the width of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Width can be set only if parent container has Horizontal orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If width is less than minimum width bar's width will be set to minimum width.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DocumentDockUIManager.SetBarHeight(DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the height of the bar that is managed by this document layout. Height can be set only if parent container has vertical orientation. Note that bar minimum size is respected by this method and it will be enforced. If height is less than minimum height bar's height will be set to minimum height.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BalloonTip.InitialDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the time (in milliseconds) that passes before the BalloonTip appears.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BalloonTip.ShowAlways
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a Balloon window is displayed even when its parent form is not active. Default value is false.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BalloonTip.BalloonControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the internal Balloon control that is used to display Balloon. This property will have valid value only during time Balloon is actually displayed on the screen. Value will also be valid during BallonDisplaying event. You can use this property to further customize Balloon control before it is displayed to the user. You can also set it to your own instance of the Balloon control (or the control that is inheriting it) for ultimate customization options. Note that new instance of Balloon control is created each time Balloon needs to be displayed. Once Balloon is closed control is disposed.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.RecalcSize
member.summary: Recalculates the layout of the Bar and repaints it. This will not change the size of the Bar it will only force the recalculation of the size for each contained item and it will repaint the bar. To ensure that Bar is resized if necessary as well call RecalcLayout method.

member.summary: Occurs on dockable bars when end-user attempts to close the individual DockContainerItem objects using system buttons on dock tab. Event can be canceled by setting the Cancel property of event arguments to true. This even will occur only after user presses the X button on tab that is displaying the dockable windows/documents.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether caption button menu for bars with grab handle task pane is automatically created. Caption menu when automatically created will display the list of all items from Items collection and it will maintain only one item from the list as visible item. To create custom caption menu that is displayed when user clicks the caption button handle CaptionButtonClick event.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.Bar.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.summary: Gets orientation within container that is supported by this item. If item does not support certain orientation the container automatically hides it when container switches into that orientation.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether item is global or not. This flag is used to propagate property changes to all items with the same name. Setting for example Visible property on the item that has GlobalItem set to true will set visible property to the same value on all items with the same name.

member.summary: Gets or sets orientation inside the container. Do not change the value of this property. It is managed by system only.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether tooltips are displayed for the buttons.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BubbleBar.ImageSizeLarge
member.summary: Gets or sets size of the images when button is enlarged, default value is 48 by 48 pixels. Note that you should provide the images in the same size for the buttons through the image properties on the buttons or through ImagesLarge property. If the large images are not provided the regular button image will be automatically enlarged.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.BubbleBar.ImageSizeNormal
member.summary: Gets or sets the normal image size for the buttons, default value is 24 by 24 pixels. This should be set to the default image size that you will use on the buttons. If the images specified for the buttons are not of the same size as the size specified here then they will be automatically resized. Normal size must always be smaller than the size specified by ImageSizeLarge property.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ForceDefinitionLoad
member.summary: Forces the loading of the definition specified in DefinitionName property. By default definition is loaded after parent form handle has been created and form is loaded. However, under certain circumstances you might need DotNetBar to load definition right away so you can access bars and items. We recommend moving the code to Form Load event and leaving the loading process for DotNetBar definition as is.

member.summary: Gets whether component has been disposed.
member.remarks: Disposed will return true after Dispose method has been executed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisposeGCCollect
member.summary: Gets or sets whether GC.Collect() is called when this component is disposed.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DockingHintsEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether DotNetBar provides docking hints for easy docking of bars.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.EnableFullSizeDock
member.summary: Gets or sets whether user can control how first bar is docked when using docking hints (default value is True). When enabled (default value) placing the mouse over the middle docking hint will dock the bar at partial size and using the far docking hint will dock bar at full size. Full size indicates that dock site which hosts the bar consumes all the space of the parent form while partial size indicates that dock site consumes the full size minus the space of the other dock sites. Default value is true.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ApplyDocumentBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether uniform styling is applied to bars docked as documents. Default value is true which means that bar that will be docked as document will have it's style changed so it fits in default document styling. Such bars will have GrabHandleStyle=None, DockTabAlignment=Top and AlwaysDisplayDockTab=true. Set this property to false to have bars keep these properties once they are docked as documents. Value of these properties will be returned back to the default values once bar is not docked as document.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Bars
member.summary: Gets the collection of the Bar objects associated with DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.IsDefinitionLoaded
member.summary: Gets whether definition is loaded.

member.summary: Gets the collection of all items that are used for end-user design-time customization.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ContextMenus
member.summary: Gets the collection of all popup menus managed by DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DispatchShortcuts
member.summary: Indicates whether shortucts handled by items are dispatched to the next handler or control.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AutoDispatchShortcuts
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of shortcut keys that are automatically dispatched to the control that has focus even if they are handled and used by one of the items. This gives you fine control over which shortcuts are passed through the system and which ones are marked as handled by DotNetBar.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ShowResetButton
member.summary: Indicates whether Reset buttons is shown that allows end-user to reset the toolbar state.

member.summary: ImageList for images used on Items. Images specified here will always be used on menu-items and are by default used on all Bars.

member.summary: ImageList for medium-sized images used on Items.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ImagesLarge
member.summary: ImageList for large-sized images used on Items.

member.summary: Suspends the bar layout for all bars.

member.summary: Specifes whether drop shadow is displayed for Menus and pop-up Bars. OfficeXP Style only.

member.summary: Specifes whether to use Alpha-Blending shadows for pop-up items if supported by target OS. Disabling Alpha-Blended shadows can improve performance.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.DisabledImagesGrayScale
member.summary: Gets or sets whether gray-scale algorithm is used to create automatic gray-scale images. Default is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether hooks are used for internal DotNetBar system functionality. Using hooks is recommended only if DotNetBar is used in hybrid environments like Visual Studio designers or IE.

member.summary: Gets or sets the DotNetBar layout string.

member.summary: Specifies that custom customize dialog will be used. Use EnterCustomize event to show your custom dialog box.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Top dock site used by DotNetBarManager.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Bottom dock site used by DotNetBarManager.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Fill dock site used by DotNetBarManager. Fill dock site is most commonly used as dock site for document type docking.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ThemeAware
member.summary: Specifies whether bars are drawn using Themes when running on OS that supports themes like Windows XP.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.Style
member.summary: Sets the style of all items in DotNetBar Manager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.ColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets Color scheme for all bars. Note that you need to set UseGlobalColorScheme to true to indicate that this ColorScheme object will be used on all bars managed by this instance of DotNetBarManager.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.UseGlobalColorScheme
member.summary: Gets or sets whether ColorScheme object on DotNetBarManager is used as a default ColorScheme for all bars managed by DotNetBarManager. Default value is false which indicates that ColorScheme on each Bar is used. When set to true each bar will use the ColorScheme settings from DotNetBarManager and it will ignore any setting on the Bar.ColorScheme object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysShowFullMenus
member.summary: Indicates whether the Personalized menu setting is ignored and full menus are always shown.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.DotNetBarManager.AlwaysDisplayKeyAccelerators
member.summary: Gets or sets whether accelerator letters for menu or toolbar commands are underlined regardless of current Windows settings. Accelerator keys allow easy access to menu commands by using Alt + choosen key (letter). Default value is false which indicates that system setting is used to determine whether accelerator letters are underlined. Setting this property to true will always display accelerator letter underlined.

member.name: M:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.ApplyStyle(DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle)
member.summary: Applies a "child/inherited" style to this style. Use this method to create style hierarchies.
member.remarks: This method is used to support style hierarchies where a base style is defined and inherited/child styles are derived and based on it. By using this method on the base style you can apply only style changes defined by the child style. For example if you defined a base style for normal user interface element then in most cases you do not want to redefine the styling for the case when same user interface element is selected. You will just defined the behavior of the selected state and then apply it to the base normal style using ApplyStyle method.
member.param: Style to apply to current style.

member.returns: New copy of ElementStyle object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ElementStyle.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the element's rectangle.

member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:DevComponents.DotNetBar.eStyleTextTrimming.EllipsisPath
member.summary: The center is removed from trimmed lines and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last slash-delimited segment of the line as possible.

member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.summary: Specifies no trimming.

member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color for UI element. If used in combination with BackgroundColor2 is specifies starting gradient color.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColorSchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor2
member.summary: Gets or sets the target gradient background color for UI element.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExpandableSplitter.BackColor2SchemePart
member.summary: Gets or sets the color scheme color that is used as target gradient background color. Setting this property overrides the setting of the corresponding BackColor2 property. Color scheme colors are automatically managed and are based on current system colors. That means if colors on the system change the color scheme will ensure that it's colors are changed as well to fit in the color scheme of target system. Set this property to eColorSchemePart.None to specify explicit color to use through BackColor2 property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.DotNetBar.ExplorerBar.SuspendLayoutDisplay
member.summary: Suspends the layout and painting of the control. When you want to perform multiple operations on the explorer bar and you want to ensure that layout of the items on it and painting is not performed for performance and appearance reasons set this property to true. Once you want to enable layout and painting set the property back to false and call RecalcLayout method. Default value is false.
